[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Black Start System Restoration document defines requirements for system restoration after a blackout, ensuring efficient grid recovery.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: The Black Start System ensures the adequate quantity and location of Black Start generators for system restoration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: The Black Start System integrates with grid systems and interconnections for restoration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: The Black Start System provides a web-based interface for operators to monitor Black Start units and test results.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: The Black Start System supports communication with grid systems and monitoring equipment.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: The Black Start System connects with CAISO operating procedures and protocols for Black Start tests.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: The Black Start System uses secure communication channels via HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: The Black Start System ensures efficient memory utilization for handling grid data and restoration tasks.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: The Black Start System operates continuously with scheduled maintenance for grid restoration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: The Black Start System is customizable for specific grid and transmission systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: The Black Start System interacts with external services for power grid synchronization and recovery.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: The Black Start System supports grid recovery by ensuring the availability and functionality of Black Start units.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: The Black Start System is designed for operators, technical staff, and regulators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: The Black Start System relies on existing grid infrastructure and the availability of Black Start-capable units.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: The Black Start System assumes the availability of Black Start units and cooperation among grid operators.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Black Start: The ability to start and deliver energy without external power.
Black Start Unit: A generator that starts and delivers energy independently.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with the CAISO operating system for grid restoration (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support communication with external monitoring and control systems for system restoration (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable remote monitoring of Black Start units (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate reports for performance testing and validation of Black Start capability (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system interface shall be user-friendly and provide real-time status updates on Black Start units.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall support at least 1,000 concurrent operations for monitoring Black Start tests.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store all Black Start testing data in a secure relational database (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall be based on modular architecture for easy upgrades and maintenance.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 27001 for security management and adhere to NERC standards for grid restoration and testing.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale based on the volume of monitoring data during system restoration (REQ-PERF-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional and performance tests will validate integration, capabilities, and grid recovery.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Guides, training manuals, and troubleshooting procedures.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 27001, NERC EOP-005, and CAISO Operating Procedures.
